title: Peer Assessment Utilization Strategies in Computer-Supported Collaborative Inquiry Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Methodology for basic research design and language analysis skills
context.additional_context: A collaborative inquiry learning process facilitated through peer assessment and dialogue in a smartphone-based, limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Learners can improve their research questions, data analysis, and conclusion-drawing processes through peer evaluation
Learners can enhance scientific literacy through peer interactions in CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) environments
Learners can develop communication strategies for effectively exchanging peer feedback using online collaboration tools

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
